hints.label: unlabeled-proof-135
hints.content:
138: 
139: :::{prf:proof}
140: The Gell-Mann matrices $\{\lambda^a\}_{a=1}^{8}$ form an orthonormal basis for $\mathfrak{su}(3)$ with respect to the Killing form:
141: 
142: $$
143: \langle A, B \rangle := \text{Tr}(A B)
144: $$
145: 
146: normalized such that $\text{Tr}(\lambda^a \lambda^b) = 2\delta^{ab}$.
147: 
148: Since $T_i^{\text{traceless}}$ is a traceless $3 \times 3$ Hermitian matrix (the force and momentum are real, so $T_i$ is real symmetric), it lies in the 8-dimensional space spanned by $\{\lambda^a\}$.
149: 
150: The decomposition coefficients are obtained by projection:
151: 
152: $$
153: \varphi_i^a = \frac{\langle T_i^{\text{traceless}}, \lambda^a \rangle}{\langle \lambda^a, \lambda^a \rangle} = \frac{\text{Tr}(T_i^{\text{traceless}} \cdot \lambda^a)}{2}
154: $$

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-205
hints.content:
208: 
209: :::{prf:proof}
210: By definition:
211: 
212: $$
213: \rho_i = \|T_i^{\text{traceless}}\|_F = \sqrt{\sum_{ab} (T_i^{\text{traceless}})_{ab}^2}
214: $$
215: 
216: where $\|\cdot\|_F$ is the Frobenius norm.
217: 
218: Since $T_i^{\text{traceless}} = \sum_a \varphi_i^a \lambda^a$ and the Gell-Mann matrices satisfy $\text{Tr}(\lambda^a \lambda^b) = 2\delta^{ab}$:
219: 
220: $$
221: \|T_i^{\text{traceless}}\|_F^2 = \text{Tr}(T_i^{\text{traceless} 2}) = \sum_{a=1}^{8} (\varphi_i^a)^2 \cdot \frac{1}{2}
222: $$
223: 
224: Wait, let me recalculate. Actually:
225: 
226: $$
227: \|T_i^{\text{traceless}}\|_F^2 = \text{Tr}((T_i^{\text{traceless}})^2) = \sum_a (\varphi_i^a)^2 \cdot \text{Tr}((\lambda^a)^2)/4
228: $$
229: 
230: Hmm, I need to be more careful. Let me use the fact that for real symmetric traceless matrices, the Frobenius norm is related to the tensor norm. Actually, for the outer product $F \otimes p$:
231: 
232: $$
233: \|F \otimes p\|_F^2 = \sum_{ab} F_a^2 p_b^2 = (\sum_a F_a^2)(\sum_b p_b^2) = \|F\|^2 \|p\|^2
234: $$
235: 
236: And the trace removal only subtracts $(F \cdot p)^2 / 3$, so:
237: 
238: $$
239: \|T_i^{\text{traceless}}\|_F^2 = \|F\|^2 \|p\|^2 - \frac{1}{3}(F \cdot p)^2
240: $$
241: 
242: So the amplitude is:
243: 
244: $$
245: \rho_i = \sqrt{\|F_i\|^2 \|p_i\|^2 - \frac{1}{3}(F_i \cdot p_i)^2}
246: $$

hints.label: rem-cg-su3-physical
hints.title: Physical Interpretation of SU(3) Structure
hints.content:
252: :label: rem-cg-su3-physical
253: 
254: The SU(3) color structure emerges naturally because:
255: 
256: 1. **Tensor product structure:** $F \otimes p$ is a rank-2 tensor in 3D space, naturally living in the adjoint representation of SU(3)
257: 
258: 2. **Traceless condition:** Removing the trace projects from U(3) to SU(3), ensuring no overall "baryon number" charge
259: 
260: 3. **8 gluons:** The 8 independent components of $T^{\text{traceless}}$ correspond exactly to the 8 gluons: $(r\bar{g}, r\bar{b}, g\bar{b}, \ldots)$
261: 
262: 4. **Coupling strength:** The amplitude $\rho_i = \|F\| \cdot \|p\|$ gives the **strong coupling constant**:
263: 
264: $$
265: g_s \propto \|F\| \cdot \|p\| \propto \|\nabla \Phi\| \cdot \|v\|
266: $$
